Package ohos.utils

Class Scope<T extends Comparable<? super T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.utils.Scope<T>

  • public final class Scope<T extends Comparable<? super T>>
extends Object
    Describes the range of valid values for a field.

    The lower bound of a range must be less than or equal to the upper bound of the range. This requires that the objects in a Scope must be comparable.

    Since:
    1

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Scope​(T lowerObj, T upperObj)
      A constructor used to create a Scope instance with the lower and upper bounds specified.

      • Scope

        public Scope​(T lowerObj,
             T upperObj)
        A constructor used to create a Scope instance with the lower and upper bounds specified.
        Parameters:
        lowerObj - Indicates the lower bound of the Scope instance.
        upperObj - Indicates the upper bound of the Scope instance.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if lowerObj or upperObj is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if lowerObj is bigger than upperObj.
        Since:

      • create

        public static <T extends Comparable<? super T>> Scope<T> create​(T lowerObj,
                                                                T upperObj)
        Creates a range whose data type is the same as the input parameters.

        The data type of input parameters must be comparable.

        Parameters:
        lowerObj - Indicates the lower bound of the Scope instance.
        upperObj - Indicates the upper bound of the Scope instance.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if lowerObj or upperObj is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if lowerObj is bigger than upperObj.
        Since:

      • clamp

        public T clamp​(T value)
        Clamps a given value to the current range.

        The given value is returned if it is within the range. The lower bound is returned if the given value is less than the lower bound; and the upper bound is returned if the given value is greater than the upper bound.

        Parameters:
        value - Indicates the value to clamp.
        Returns:
        Returns the value clamped to the current range.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if value is null.
        Since:
        1

      • contains

        public boolean contains​(T value)
        Checks whether a given value is within the current range.

        A value is within a range if it is greater than or equal to the lower bound and less than or equal to the upper bound of the range.

        Parameters:
        value - Indicates the value to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the given value is within the range; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if value is null.
        Since:
        1

      • contains

        public boolean contains​(Scope<T> range)
        Checks whether a given range is within the current range.

        The given range is within the current range if its lower bound is greater than or equal to the lower bound of the current range and its upper bound is less than or equal to the upper bound of the current range.

        Parameters:
        range - Indicates the range to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the given range is within the current range; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if range is null.
        Since:
        1

      • expand

        public Scope<T> expand​(Scope<T> range)
        Creates the smallest range that includes the current range and a given range.

        The lower bound of the range to create is the smaller value between the lower bound of the current range and that of the given range. The upper bound of the range to create is the larger value between the upper bound of the current range and that of the given range.

        Parameters:
        range - Indicates the range used together with the current range to create their extension.
        Returns:
        Returns the smallest range that includes the current range and the given range.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if range is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if lowerObj is bigger than upperObj.
        Since:
        1

      • expand

        public Scope<T> expand​(T lowerObj,
                       T upperObj)
        Creates the smallest range that includes the current range and the given lower and upper bounds.

        The lower bound of the range to create is the smaller value between the lower bound of the current range and the given lower bound. The upper bound of the range to create is the larger value between the upper bound of the current range and the given upper bound.

        Parameters:
        lowerObj - Indicates the lower bound.
        upperObj - Indicates the upper bound.
        Returns:
        Returns the smallest range that includes the current range and the given lower and upper bounds.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if lowerObj or upperObj is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if lowerObj is bigger than upperObj.
        Since:
        1

      • expand

        public Scope<T> expand​(T value)
        Creates the smallest range that includes the current range and a given value.

        The lower bound of the range to create is the smaller value between the lower bound of the current range and the given value. The upper bound of the range to create is the larger value between the upper bound of the current range and the given value.

        Parameters:
        value - Indicates the given value.
        Returns:
        Returns the smallest range that includes the current range and the given value.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if value is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if lowerObj is bigger than upperObj.
        Since:
        1
